verb.description: Be present at (an event, meeting, or function)
examples: the entire sales force attended the conference
she was unable to attend the wedding
he muttered that he had business to attend to

verb.description: Escort or accompany (a member of royalty or other important personage) so as to assist them; wait on.
examples: Her Royal Highness was attended by two capable women

verb.description: Occur with or as a result of.
examples: people feared that the switch to a peacetime economy would be attended by a severe slump

origin: Middle English (in the sense apply one's mind or energies to): from Old French atendre, from Latin attendere, from ad- to + tendere stretch.
